alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Halifax; Nash (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Nash, Edgecombe and southern Halifax Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking the strongest thunderstorm in the line near Tarboro, moving east at 25 mph. The line of storms extends westward to Nashville. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Tarboro, Nashville, Scotland Neck, Dortches, Red Oak, Princeville, Whitakers, Hobgood and Speed. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
